author: noahfig.eth
content: Hi there! Where can I find some documentation to actually send a blob transactions to ethereum. My question is where do I actually send the data of the blob ? To a beacon node ?

author: __flcl
content:
It's simple: as a user you send transaction to the execution client using eth_sendRawTransaction, encoding contains blobs/commitments/proofs.

What happens next: when consensus client asks execution client for a new block, execution client uses blob txs from the pool, makes block with them, and sends blobs/commitments/proofs in so called "BlobsBundle" along with newly built payload. If consensus client wants execution client to just validate block, it will not send blobs back, just hashes.

author: __flcl
content: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4844#networking describes the encoding of what you send via `eth_sendRawTransaction`, you need to prepend it with 0x03 also
